speaker: OCTAVIUS
text_entry: ACT I

speaker: OCTAVIUS
text_entry: SCENE I. King Lear's palace.

speaker: OCTAVIUS
text_entry: Enter KENT, GLOUCESTER, and EDMUND

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I thought the king had more affected the Duke of

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Albany than Cornwall.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: It did always seem so to us: but now, in the

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: division of the kingdom, it appears not which of

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: the dukes he values most; for equalities are so

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: weighed, that curiosity in neither can make choice

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: of either's moiety.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Is not this your son, my lord?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: His breeding, sir, hath been at my charge: I have

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: so often blushed to acknowledge him, that now I am

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: brazed to it.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I cannot conceive you.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Sir, this young fellow's mother could: whereupon

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: she grew round-wombed, and had, indeed, sir, a son

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: for her cradle ere she had a husband for her bed.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Do you smell a fault?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I cannot wish the fault undone, the issue of it

speaker: KENT
text_entry: being so proper.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But I have, sir, a son by order of law, some year

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: elder than this, who yet is no dearer in my account:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: though this knave came something saucily into the

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: world before he was sent for, yet was his mother

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: fair; there was good sport at his making, and the

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: whoreson must be acknowledged. Do you know this

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: noble gentleman, Edmund?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: No, my lord.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: My lord of Kent: remember him hereafter as my

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: honourable friend.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: My services to your lordship.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I must love you, and sue to know you better.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Sir, I shall study deserving.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: He hath been out nine years, and away he shall

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: again. The king is coming.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Sennet. Enter KING LEAR, CORNWALL, ALBANY, GONERIL, REGAN, CORDELIA, and Attendants

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Attend the lords of France and Burgundy, Gloucester.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I shall, my liege.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exeunt GLOUCESTER and EDMUND

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Meantime we shall express our darker purpose.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Give me the map there. Know that we have divided

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: In three our kingdom: and 'tis our fast intent

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To shake all cares and business from our age;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Conferring them on younger strengths, while we

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Unburthen'd crawl toward death. Our son of Cornwall,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And you, our no less loving son of Albany,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: We have this hour a constant will to publish

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Our daughters' several dowers, that future strife

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: May be prevented now. The princes, France and Burgundy,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Great rivals in our youngest daughter's love,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Long in our court have made their amorous sojourn,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And here are to be answer'd. Tell me, my daughters,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Since now we will divest us both of rule,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Interest of territory, cares of state,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Which of you shall we say doth love us most?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That we our largest bounty may extend

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Where nature doth with merit challenge. Goneril,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Our eldest-born, speak first.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Sir, I love you more than words can wield the matter;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Dearer than eye-sight, space, and liberty;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Beyond what can be valued, rich or rare;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: No less than life, with grace, health, beauty, honour;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: As much as child e'er loved, or father found;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: A love that makes breath poor, and speech unable;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Beyond all manner of so much I love you.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: [Aside]  What shall Cordelia do?

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Love, and be silent.

speaker: LEAR
text_entry: Of all these bounds, even from this line to this,

speaker: LEAR
text_entry: With shadowy forests and with champains rich'd,

speaker: LEAR
text_entry: With plenteous rivers and wide-skirted meads,

speaker: LEAR
text_entry: We make thee lady: to thine and Albany's issue

speaker: LEAR
text_entry: Be this perpetual. What says our second daughter,

speaker: LEAR
text_entry: Our dearest Regan, wife to Cornwall? Speak.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Sir, I am made

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Of the self-same metal that my sister is,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: And prize me at her worth. In my true heart

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: I find she names my very deed of love;

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Only she comes too short: that I profess

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Myself an enemy to all other joys,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Which the most precious square of sense possesses;

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: And find I am alone felicitate

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: In your dear highness' love.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: [Aside] Then poor Cordelia!

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: And yet not so; since, I am sure, my love's

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: More richer than my tongue.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To thee and thine hereditary ever

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Remain this ample third of our fair kingdom;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: No less in space, validity, and pleasure,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Than that conferr'd on Goneril. Now, our joy,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Although the last, not least; to whose young love

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The vines of France and milk of Burgundy

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Strive to be interess'd; what can you say to draw

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: A third more opulent than your sisters? Speak.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Nothing, my lord.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Nothing!

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Nothing.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Nothing will come of nothing: speak again.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Unhappy that I am, I cannot heave

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: My heart into my mouth: I love your majesty

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: According to my bond; nor more nor less.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: How, how, Cordelia! mend your speech a little,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Lest it may mar your fortunes.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Good my lord,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: You have begot me, bred me, loved me: I

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Return those duties back as are right fit,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Obey you, love you, and most honour you.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Why have my sisters husbands, if they say

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: They love you all? Haply, when I shall wed,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: That lord whose hand must take my plight shall carry

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Half my love with him, half my care and duty:

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Sure, I shall never marry like my sisters,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: To love my father all.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: But goes thy heart with this?

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Ay, good my lord.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: So young, and so untender?

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: So young, my lord, and true.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let it be so; thy truth, then, be thy dower:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: For, by the sacred radiance of the sun,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The mysteries of Hecate, and the night;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: By all the operation of the orbs

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: From whom we do exist, and cease to be;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Here I disclaim all my paternal care,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Propinquity and property of blood,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And as a stranger to my heart and me

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Hold thee, from this, for ever. The barbarous Scythian,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Or he that makes his generation messes

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To gorge his appetite, shall to my bosom

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Be as well neighbour'd, pitied, and relieved,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: As thou my sometime daughter.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Good my liege,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Peace, Kent!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Come not between the dragon and his wrath.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I loved her most, and thought to set my rest

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: On her kind nursery. Hence, and avoid my sight!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: So be my grave my peace, as here I give

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Her father's heart from her! Call France; who stirs?

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Call Burgundy. Cornwall and Albany,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: With my two daughters' dowers digest this third:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Let pride, which she calls plainness, marry her.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I do invest you jointly with my power,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Pre-eminence, and all the large effects

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That troop with majesty. Ourself, by monthly course,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: With reservation of an hundred knights,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: By you to be sustain'd, shall our abode

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Make with you by due turns. Only we still retain

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The name, and all the additions to a king;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The sway, revenue, execution of the rest,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Beloved sons, be yours: which to confirm,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: This coronet part betwixt you.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Giving the crown

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Royal Lear,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Whom I have ever honour'd as my king,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Loved as my father, as my master follow'd,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: As my great patron thought on in my prayers,--

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The bow is bent and drawn, make from the shaft.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Let it fall rather, though the fork invade

speaker: KENT
text_entry: The region of my heart: be Kent unmannerly,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: When Lear is mad. What wilt thou do, old man?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Think'st thou that duty shall have dread to speak,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: When power to flattery bows? To plainness honour's bound,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: When majesty stoops to folly. Reverse thy doom;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: And, in thy best consideration, cheque

speaker: KENT
text_entry: This hideous rashness: answer my life my judgment,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Thy youngest daughter does not love thee least;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Nor are those empty-hearted whose low sound

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Reverbs no hollowness.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Kent, on thy life, no more.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: My life I never held but as a pawn

speaker: KENT
text_entry: To wage against thy enemies; nor fear to lose it,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Thy safety being the motive.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Out of my sight!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: See better, Lear; and let me still remain

speaker: KENT
text_entry: The true blank of thine eye.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Now, by Apollo,--

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Now, by Apollo, king,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Thou swear'st thy gods in vain.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: O, vassal! miscreant!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Laying his hand on his sword

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Dear sir, forbear.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Do:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Kill thy physician, and the fee bestow

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Upon thy foul disease. Revoke thy doom;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Or, whilst I can vent clamour from my throat,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I'll tell thee thou dost evil.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Hear me, recreant!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: On thine allegiance, hear me!

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Since thou hast sought to make us break our vow,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Which we durst never yet, and with strain'd pride

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To come between our sentence and our power,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Which nor our nature nor our place can bear,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Our potency made good, take thy reward.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Five days we do allot thee, for provision

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To shield thee from diseases of the world;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And on the sixth to turn thy hated back

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Upon our kingdom: if, on the tenth day following,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thy banish'd trunk be found in our dominions,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: The moment is thy death. Away! by Jupiter,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: This shall not be revoked.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Fare thee well, king: sith thus thou wilt appear,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Freedom lives hence, and banishment is here.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: To CORDELIA

speaker: KENT
text_entry: The gods to their dear shelter take thee, maid,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: That justly think'st, and hast most rightly said!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: To REGAN and GONERIL

speaker: KENT
text_entry: And your large speeches may your deeds approve,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: That good effects may spring from words of love.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Thus Kent, O princes, bids you all adieu;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: He'll shape his old course in a country new.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Flourish. Re-enter GLOUCESTER, with KING OF FRANCE, BURGUNDY, and Attendants

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Here's France and Burgundy, my noble lord.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: My lord of Burgundy.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: We first address towards you, who with this king

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Hath rivall'd for our daughter: what, in the least,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Will you require in present dower with her,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Or cease your quest of love?

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: Most royal majesty,

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: I crave no more than what your highness offer'd,

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: Nor will you tender less.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Right noble Burgundy,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: When she was dear to us, we did hold her so;

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: But now her price is fall'n. Sir, there she stands:

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: If aught within that little seeming substance,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Or all of it, with our displeasure pieced,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: And nothing more, may fitly like your grace,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: She's there, and she is yours.

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: I know no answer.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Will you, with those infirmities she owes,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Unfriended, new-adopted to our hate,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Dower'd with our curse, and stranger'd with our oath,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Take her, or leave her?

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: Pardon me, royal sir;

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: Election makes not up on such conditions.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Then leave her, sir; for, by the power that made me,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I tell you all her wealth.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To KING OF FRANCE

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: For you, great king,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: I would not from your love make such a stray,

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To match you where I hate; therefore beseech you

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: To avert your liking a more worthier way

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Than on a wretch whom nature is ashamed

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Almost to acknowledge hers.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: This is most strange,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: That she, that even but now was your best object,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: The argument of your praise, balm of your age,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Most best, most dearest, should in this trice of time

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Commit a thing so monstrous, to dismantle

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: So many folds of favour. Sure, her offence

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Must be of such unnatural degree,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: That monsters it, or your fore-vouch'd affection

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Fall'n into taint: which to believe of her,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Must be a faith that reason without miracle

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Could never plant in me.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: I yet beseech your majesty,--

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: If for I want that glib and oily art,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: To speak and purpose not; since what I well intend,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: I'll do't before I speak,--that you make known

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: It is no vicious blot, murder, or foulness,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: No unchaste action, or dishonour'd step,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: That hath deprived me of your grace and favour;

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: But even for want of that for which I am richer,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: A still-soliciting eye, and such a tongue

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: As I am glad I have not, though not to have it

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Hath lost me in your liking.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Better thou

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Hadst not been born than not to have pleased me better.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Is it but this,--a tardiness in nature

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Which often leaves the history unspoke

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: That it intends to do? My lord of Burgundy,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: What say you to the lady? Love's not love

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: When it is mingled with regards that stand

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Aloof from the entire point. Will you have her?

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: She is herself a dowry.

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: Royal Lear,

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: Give but that portion which yourself proposed,

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: And here I take Cordelia by the hand,

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: Duchess of Burgundy.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Nothing: I have sworn; I am firm.

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: I am sorry, then, you have so lost a father

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: That you must lose a husband.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Peace be with Burgundy!

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Since that respects of fortune are his love,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: I shall not be his wife.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Fairest Cordelia, that art most rich, being poor;

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Most choice, forsaken; and most loved, despised!

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Thee and thy virtues here I seize upon:

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Be it lawful I take up what's cast away.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Gods, gods! 'tis strange that from their cold'st neglect

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: My love should kindle to inflamed respect.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Thy dowerless daughter, king, thrown to my chance,

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Is queen of us, of ours, and our fair France:

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Not all the dukes of waterish Burgundy

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Can buy this unprized precious maid of me.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Bid them farewell, Cordelia, though unkind:

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Thou losest here, a better where to find.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Thou hast her, France: let her be thine; for we

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Have no such daughter, nor shall ever see

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: That face of hers again. Therefore be gone

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Without our grace, our love, our benison.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Come, noble Burgundy.

speaker: KING LEAR
text_entry: Flourish. Exeunt all but KING OF FRANCE, GONERIL, REGAN, and CORDELIA

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Bid farewell to your sisters.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: The jewels of our father, with wash'd eyes

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Cordelia leaves you: I know you what you are;

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: And like a sister am most loath to call

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Your faults as they are named. Use well our father:

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: To your professed bosoms I commit him

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: But yet, alas, stood I within his grace,

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: I would prefer him to a better place.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: So, farewell to you both.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Prescribe not us our duties.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Let your study

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Be to content your lord, who hath received you

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: At fortune's alms. You have obedience scanted,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: And well are worth the want that you have wanted.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Time shall unfold what plaited cunning hides:

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Who cover faults, at last shame them derides.

speaker: CORDELIA
text_entry: Well may you prosper!

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Come, my fair Cordelia.

speaker: KING OF FRANCE
text_entry: Exeunt KING OF FRANCE and CORDELIA

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Sister, it is not a little I have to say of what

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: most nearly appertains to us both. I think our

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: father will hence to-night.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: That's most certain, and with you; next month with us.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: You see how full of changes his age is; the

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: observation we have made of it hath not been

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: little: he always loved our sister most; and

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: with what poor judgment he hath now cast her off

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: appears too grossly.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: 'Tis the infirmity of his age: yet he hath ever

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: but slenderly known himself.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: The best and soundest of his time hath been but

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: rash; then must we look to receive from his age,

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: not alone the imperfections of long-engraffed

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: condition, but therewithal the unruly waywardness

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: that infirm and choleric years bring with them.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Such unconstant starts are we like to have from

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: him as this of Kent's banishment.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: There is further compliment of leavetaking

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: between France and him. Pray you, let's hit

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: together: if our father carry authority with

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: such dispositions as he bears, this last

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: surrender of his will but offend us.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: We shall further think on't.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: We must do something, and i' the heat.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Exeunt
